About

Hi my name is Mauricio Rivera and I’m a San Francisco native with interests in finance, technology, development, user interfaces, and sports.

I’m currently living in Los Angeles pushing forward some personal projects in design and technology and enjoying the summer weather.

I have worked on a number of cool projects. Most recently I worked at GoldSilver.com, a global gold and silver dealership, where I ran technology, user interface, and finance teams. I have done work as a financial and technology consultant, and previously I worked at Loyola Marymount University.

I graduated from UC Santa Barbara with a BA and Loyola Marymount University where I earned an MBA with dual emphases in Finance and Decision Science. I am currently a CFA Level 3 candidate.

I’m interested in chess, sports, technology, numbers, films, and literature. Some of my favorite things are Pocket, the San Francisco Giants, Barça FC, USMNT, github, the Golden State Warriors, the San Francisco 49ers, Songza, Neal Stephenson books, the Long Now Foundation, and Mexican food.

Contact

Connect with me via social media or say hi via email.

Colophon

This website was created on a MacBook Air with Google Chrome and Sublime Text 2. The site is published with Jekyll and HTML5 Boilerplate. The sites are composed in Markdown.

The types are set in Lato and Roboto Condensed, both served by Google Web Fonts.
